reviewText:
Pros:
-Multiplayer, single player and local multiplayer
-Fun lobby system
-Amazing art
-Full controller support (it says partial because you can't chat I think?)
-Fully scripted and moddable

Cons
-Possibility of low population is servers (note: I write this before Steam release, servers were often nearly empty because the game wasn't really known)
-Small amount you can do with coins in the lobby (you get coins for winning games which you can spend on costumes, pets & more).
-30FPS (if it bothers you)

Trench Run is a very fun shooter you can plenty of hours from, even if you can't find someone to play with all the time playing versus bots is enjoyable and you can play with up to 4 friends from your couch with controllers. Considering it's price, it's certainly worth checking out.
voteText: 38 of 52 people (73%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Fast, accessible and completely hilarious mayhem. You have two game modes to choose from and one of the best online multiplayer lobbies I've ever seen in my life. There is the Skirmish mode, which is a free for all single life per round game mode. First to get eight kills wins the match. Second there is the Run mode, two teams try to reach the opposite side of the map. First team to cross, or eliminate the other team, wins. Match is the best of five rounds. There are simple yet distinct classes to choose from, based on classic shooter archetypes.

And the lobby is seriously entertaining too. Hang out and chat at the barrista, play a pick up game of 2D basketball, or pick up a fancy outfit or a pet. Of course you can always spend your hard earned winnings the old fashioned way and get hammered at the bar.

The game also boasts crisp and responsive controls and totally over the top physics. Round that out with online and local multiplayer with full bot support so you never have to go without a game. Totally worth the price of entry and then some.
voteText: 17 of 24 people (71%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
If you were a fan of King Arthur’s Gold then I have some delightful news to share with you – if you weren’t already aware. Transhuman Design are back with their second Steam game. This time the indie geniuses have put their mind to a multiplayer intended action game that features a sweet singleplayer mode for those who can’t get into a multiplayer game. To date Steamified have featured several multiplayer (including local multiplayer only) games that have been pretty much presumed dead on arrival for a lack of a competent singleplayer mode. I’d like those developers to cast a watchful eye over this game and study it. You can create a game that is fully intended to be played as a multiplayer game – which I believe Trench Run is – and have a successful and well implemented singleplayer mode. It may not save your game entirely but it will give those who gave you their hard earned cash the ability to play your game and not immediately utilize Steam’s refund system.

The fact of the matter is that I have yet to get into a local or online multiplayer game of Trench Run. This could have annoyed the hell out of me. I could have screamed blue murder at the developer but they implemented one hell of a singleplayer mode that makes me think that the game is a worthy purchase even if you never end up playing the fully realized multiplayer game. Yes, I’d love to get a game but  I haven’t had any luck yet. That’s okay because I play on the Australian servers and usually at weird times. I’m certain that I will get into a game at some point. I can try to play on other servers but as is generally the case with region specific servers I fear that the lag would make the game unplayable for me and that I would be at such a disadvantage as to not make the game a particularly enjoyable experience. This is not on the hands of the developers but a simple reality given the quality of Australia’s Internet and the distance data must travel.

The lobby is one of the best for any online game I have ever seen. I love the fact that there is quite a bit to do in this mode while you wait for other players to come on board unless you want to get straight to the action and play the single player mode which is, I believe, the same as games with real players but where you play against bots so that you can get into games quicker. The bots aren’t just a pathetic challenge either as their AI has been programmed very well. Other players, who I hope to play with at some point, have argued that their AI is much better than a lot of the players that they’ve had actual matches with so I have to give kudos to the devs on a job well done.

The pixel graphics are fantastic but that was one of the trademarks of King Arthur’s Gold so it is a continuation of what we have come to expect from the devs. I love the choice of music as it really meshes with the gameplay that I have experienced thus far and it makes for a fantastic touch to the lobby.

Just as I was about to quit my session another player came on and we were able to have a game with bots. Thanks to ‘Iron Raccoon’. The game was fun and very similar to the normal bot games but Iron Racoon ended up winning the game and doing very well.

Unfortunately the game currently lacks achievements and trading cards so I hope that they are added in the future.

reviewText:
I'm terrible at writing, so I'll just give a pros/cons list.

Pros:
+4 player local co-op (If you have friends that is)
+A lobby area to chill and talk with other players between matches, or maybe play a friendly game of basketball
+Class variety. No 2 classes play the same, so you're bound to find your preferred style of play.
+Jazzy Soundtrack (yes, I know that's very subjective)
+Controller support

Cons:
-There's no in-game progression. Yes you can buy cosmetic stuff in the lobby, but that's only for the lobby. I know some people out there would probably like some game-changing items to buy.
-locked at 30fps (although it doesn't really matter too much)
-Possibly low number of players (the steam release hasn't hit full swing as of writing this review)

Neutral
=A bit of a casual game. This is a great game to play with friends and make new ones, but as far as the competitive scene goes, I don't see it going too far (who knows? I might be wrong)

reviewText:
Product received for free

Review written on Saturday, May 14th, 2016
Review
This is a casual Multiplayer game, which means that you won't find a Story mode here.
There are two game modes for Local and Online: Skirmish and Run.

Skirmish:
For 4 players (humans or bots)
Free For All - Every man for himself!
You must have 8 kills to win
The winner gets coins which can be spent on the Lobby
You can choose between 4 classes: Sniper, Commando, Assault and Demolitions
Run:
For 10 playes (humans or bots)
Two teams with 5 playes each
Each team starts in one side of the map. The goal is to cross the map and reach the other side
Best of 5 rounds
In both game modes you'll find:
If you get shot you fall on the ground. If you manage to get a medkit (drops from the sky on a parachute) before the end of round you'll be up on foot and back on the game
You start with limited ammo, but just like the medkits it also drops from the sky
Each round lasts 1 minute
The online mode unfortunately is a desert place even though it has an entertaining Lobby.
You can spend here the coins you win:
To buy skins
To buy pets
To buy toys for your pets
To drink coffee, beer or wine
You can ask the band to play a song
You can play 2D basketball
You can see the Leaderboards to find out who has the most wins, loses, who drank more and who score the most on basketball
Rating:
7/10

Pros: Funny Lobby
Challenging AI. I haven't won a game against the bots yet on Skirmish mode, only on Run mode
Windows, Mac and Linux version
Cons: No achievements (if it bothers you)
No trading cards
Empty servers
For similar reviews and great giveaways please visit Steamified[www.steamified.com]

reviewText:
Trench Run is a 2D multiplayer shooter that is exclusively about shooting people, blowing them up, and having fun in the process

The gameplay is very simple: you control your characters using only only 2 buttons and direction keys (you could play with a NES controller), the maps are small, there's no story, no base-building, no leveling system… You can immediately buy the game, join a server and blow stuff up. The game is very fast paced, with explosions all over the place, corpses flying across the map, buildings getting blown up, it's very hectic and hilarious to see.

There are 5 classes available that play quite differently:
- the assault has an automatic rifle and grenades
- the demolition has a rocket launcher and C4
- the commando has a knife, flash grenades, can climb walls and defuse C4
- the sniper has a sniper and can camouflage
- the medic, only available in “Run” mode, has a shield, ammo boxes, and can revive his teammates

There are 2 game modes: Run and Skirmish. Skirmish is self-explanatory, it's 4 players trying to kill each other, the player with the most kills win.

Run is a team vs team mode where the goal is to run to the other end of the map while dodging enemies and killing them. There's a bit of tactic involved : you can try to be sneaky, hiding in a bush or using a flash grenade, or defend a strategical corridor from a window, or be a medic and help your teammates with ammo and health.

Outside of the 2 main modes there's a lobby where players can meet in between matches, chat, play basketball, buy pets and costumes and drink beers.

There could easily be new modes, maps and even classes created for the game as it's entirely moddable, and you can run your own private servers.

So this game is awesome, but it has a population problem. There's generally always someone to play with, but the most I've seen online was 6 players and sometimes I have to wait 10 minutes in the lobby for someone to connect. You can still play with bots, they're not too bad, but playing with real people is obviously way more fun. If you're lucky and have irl friends who are into fun games, you could play with them in local multiplayer too (up to 4 players).

reviewText:
Pros/Cons list here:
Pros:
-Good server joining along with stable servers.
-Fun and chaotic gameplay with a lean towards casual gaming but can be taken seriously.
-Friendly community and devs.
-Bots can take the place of people that aren't there so you don't need full games to have fun.
-Modding support, not many have toyed with this yet due to this game's age but the devs are generally willing to help.
-Great for couch parties due to its fun and chaotic gameplay.
Cons:
-Needs more than the current 2 gamemodes(4 player Free For All, and a RUN gamemode where 2 platoons of 5 unique classes try to get to the other side of the map or kill the other team)
-low player count, but I think that will be fixed as this game gains popularity.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Overall, it's replayability isn't insane but it's price is worth it!

reviewText:
I was a big fan of King Arthur's Gold, which is what brought me to this game. Overall I feel this game is pretty disappointing. The core game itself is pretty shallow. There are two game modes. One is FFA, and one is Team Battle mode. The games last on average between 2-5 minutes. This game is very fast-paced. You will spend an equal time waiting between matches as you will playing them.

The game tries to redeem itself with a lobby area. Here you can buy things with coins (earned from winning games) such as beer, wine, clothes, pets. This part of the game feels pretty tacked on, and is unrelated to the main part of the game. There are not very many people online right now, and filling up games is very difficult. The game seems to be using the exact same engine as KAG, which makes the experience feel more like a cheap reskin than a full new game.

I felt the core game to be pretty uninteresting, and you can see the majority of gameplay in about 20 minutes. This game definitely feels like an Early Access game, and I was suprised it wasn't one. I hope the developers can turn it around, because at the moment I feel that purchasing this game is not worth the price.

reviewText:
I got a pre order key of this game and have been hyped all the way. And lets just say it met my expectations.

It is a fun and a very fast paced game. Every round can last a minute, and some of mine have lasted a just two seconds. The unpredicatable mechanics turn every sniper shot into a cross map scenic flight, grenades into trick shotting basketballs and rockets into ridable objects of mass destruction.

Some people may be put off by the 'aim with wsad or arrow keys' for sniper shots, rockets, grenades, basketballs and flashbangs. It takes a while to get used to it, but once learnt makes the games so much more enjoyable. Heated battles are ensured when a commando is running up behind you, and your sniper aim is pointing the other way. Who will win?

The fact that you can be blown across the map, into a medic kit and instantly start shooting again adds another dimension. You are no longer the 'spectating, bored, dead kid' when shot. Now you can watch people slash at your crawling, feeble corpse or jump in front of a sniper shot and get flung into a building.

And the lobby, don't get me started on the lobby. You can 'booze out' with your friends, buying wine, beer, cigars and even coffee with coins earnt winning games. You can grab a insulting parrot, a fluffy bunny, a crocodile or even a boring old potted cactus or fern at the pet shop, Or why not dress up as your favourite class, a horses butt, a stylish shoot or the rare IM RICH suit. You could also play fetch with a dog, bounce on your croc or try to play fetch with your pet fern. You can also chill with your friends playing basketball, or throw your pet chicken at each other.

The fact that the matches last for no time at all, allow collecting coins quickly. I spent half an hour to get a pet fern, then a chicken, a horse butt costume then finally an assault class costume.

The only downside at the moment is the lack of players, but that is due to the fact that it has just been released.

Buy it, you are missing out. Also explosions, many, many explosions.
